Generation III.Ruby: Makuhita is tenacious - it will keep getting up and attacking its foe however many times it is knocked down. Every time it gets back up, this Pok é mon stores more energy in its body for evolving.
Generation III.Sapphire: Makuhita has a tireless spirit - it will never give up hope. It eats a lot of food, gets plenty of sleep, and it trains very rigorously. By living that way, this Pok é mon packs its body with energy.
Generation III.Emerald: It loves to toughen up its body above all else. If you hear quaking rumbles in a cave, it is the sound of Makuhita undertaking strenuous training.
Generation III.FireRed: It grows stronger by enduring harsh training. It is a gutsy Pok é mon that can withstand any attack.
Generation III.LeafGreen: It grows stronger by enduring harsh training. It is a gutsy Pok é mon that can withstand any attack.

Generation IV.Diamond: It toughens its body by slamming into thick trees. Many snapped trees can be found near its nest.
Generation IV.Pearl: It toughens its body by slamming into thick trees. Many snapped trees can be found near its nest.
Generation IV.Platinum: It toughens its body by slamming into thick trees. Many snapped trees can be found near its nest.
Generation IV.HeartGold: It toughens up by slamming into thick trees over and over. It gains a sturdy body and dauntless spirit.
Generation IV.SoulSilver: It toughens up by slamming into thick trees over and over. It gains a sturdy body and dauntless spirit.

Generation VI.X: It toughens up by slamming into thick trees over and over. It gains a sturdy body and dauntless spirit.
Generation VI.Y: It grows stronger by enduring harsh training. It is a gutsy Pokémon that can withstand any attack.
Generation VI.Omega Ruby: Makuhita is tenacious—it will keep getting up and attacking its foe however many times it is knocked down. Every time it gets back up, this Pokémon stores more energy in its body for evolving.
Generation VI.Alpha Sapphire: Makuhita has a tireless spirit—it will never give up hope. It eats a lot of food, gets plenty of sleep, and it trains very rigorously. By living that way, this Pokémon packs its body with energy.

Generation VII.Sun: It was originally brought in from another region, but now Makuhita from Alola are more famous.
Generation VII.Moon: Their daily routine consists of training together first thing in the morning, eating and napping in the afternoon, and then more training afterward.
Generation VII.Ultra Sun: It practices its slaps by repeatedly slapping tree trunks. It has been known to slap an Exeggutor and get flung away.
Generation VII.Ultra Moon: There's a rumor of a traditional recipe for stew that Trainers can use to raise strong Makuhita.

Generation VIII.Brilliant Diamond: It toughens its body by slamming into thick trees. Many snapped trees can be found near its nest.
Generation VIII.Shining Pearl: It toughens its body by slamming into thick trees. Many snapped trees can be found near its nest.

Generation IX.Violet: It toughens up by slamming into thick trees over and over. It gains a sturdy body and dauntless spirit.
